alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:29PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties near Petrified Forest National Park and areas along I-40 through 425 MST /525 MDT/... At 325 PM MST /425 MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sun Valley, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, winds up to 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may result in muddy road conditions on unpaved surfaces, ponding of water on area roadways, and minor flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petrified Forest National Park, Sun Valley and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 296 and 318. Highway 180 between mile markers 316 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and impassable roads due to mud! Do not drive your vehicle through flooded or muddy roadways!

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
